intro: Furcraea melanodonta, commonly known as the black-leaved furcraea, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are often marked with prominent veins. It produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in the spring. Furcraea melanodonta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and resilience to drought conditions.
